The Business Administration – Marketing program at the college prepares students for careers in various business sectors such as advertising agencies, marketing consulting firms, telecommunication and media, digital marketing, retailers, financial institutions, government, not-for-profit, and small businesses. Graduates from this program have secured jobs as marketing coordinator, account executive, product manager, social media coordinator, digital marketing manager, medical planner or media buyer, market researcher, event marketer, sales account manager, and small business owner.

Students who complete the program can further their studies by enrolling in additional marketing programs at George Brown College. These include the Honours Bachelor of Commerce (Digital Marketing) Program B312, Sport and Event Marketing Program (Postgraduate) B400, Marketing Management – Financial Services Program (Postgraduate) B406, Strategic Relationship Marketing Program (Postgraduate) B409, and Marketing Management – Digital Media Program (Postgraduate) B433.

To graduate from the program, students must complete a total of 37 courses: 30 mandatory courses, 4 business electives, and 3 general education electives. Depending on their placement test results, students may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) or MATH 1027 (Business Math with Remediation) before progressing to other courses, but these do not count towards the 38 courses required for graduation and will incur additional charges. Students are required to make up any failed or dropped courses before they can graduate. General education courses must be chosen from at least two of the following categories: Social Sciences (GSSC), Arts and Humanities (GHUM), or Science and Technology (GSCI). Students are responsible for making up any failed or dropped courses.
